dt: {bc}rhythmical throbbing or vibrating (as of an artery)
{bc}a periodically recurring alternate increase and decrease of a quantity (such as pressure, volume, or voltage)

et: Middle English {it}pulsacioun,{/it} borrowed from Medieval Latin {it}pulsātiōn-, pulsātiō,{/it} going back to Latin, "repeated striking, knocking (on a door)," from {it}pulsāre{/it} "to strike with repeated blows, beat, (in passive) beat wildly (of the heart)" + {it}-tiōn-, -tiō,{/it} suffix of verbal action {ma}{mat|pulsate|pulsate}{/ma}
shortdef: rhythmical throbbing or vibrating (as of an artery); also : a single beat or throb
a periodically recurring alternate increase and decrease of a quantity (such as pressure, volume, or voltage)
